comments.body: Will this ever be None? It defaults to 30, and the minimum allowed by AWS is 5. I think we don't need to check 'is not None'.
I've removed the defaults because they are not a good idea - if someone didn't specify the parameter but changed it via the AWS console then the module would end up changing it.

If this is ever None then line [341](https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/19492/files#diff-c008972f0ccccd4a4d9b8c1de95c4d08R341) is going to raise an ugly error. Since this defaults to 200 I think you should remove the check here, since if they set it to an empty string it will cause problems anyway (and they should probably know better).
Should not assign TargetType if Boto version doesn't support it and it is "Instance" (the default).
